The more and more I thought of it\, the more I realized why Neil and company had made this game so polarizing. The same reason why Ellie couldn’t let go of her want for revenge\, we couldn’t let go of the hurt we experienced when Joel died. Sure we feel hatred for Abby\, that was exactly the point. But if you are willing to unconditionally love the game for what it is and not what you wanted it to be\, you can totally enjoy and understand a game. Troy Baker made this point about the game in an interview and it really opened my eyes on why this really is a masterpiece. Not everyone is willing to believe that\, in fact I had some struggles with it too but it all depends on how long you want to let go of what could’ve been and not what is. At the end of the day\, this game is what it is and I’m sure everyone who’s played it from start to finish would agree that when it shines\, it **** shines. Once you go back to the first game and realize how different and yet how similar a game it is to it’s sequel\, you notice that Naughty Dog was never planning to do anything like it again. Sequels need to do something new and the fact that it’s getting hate\, means that it’s really doing it’s job\, other than the fact that the leaks made some people stubborn. Ultimately\, I now understand why critics say this is a masterpiece\, even though the word has been overused. Take your time with it because it is the game of the year\, no question\, and it will be a polarizing release in Naughty Dog’s catalog for years to come.
